segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the advanced security audit policy setting, Audit Account Lockout, which enables you to audit security events that are generated by a failed attempt to log on to an account that is locked out.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the advanced security audit policy setting, Audit Account Lockout, which enables you to audit security events that are generated by a failed attempt to log on to an account that is locked out.

segment.source: Audit Account Lockout enables you to audit security events that are generated by a failed attempt to log on to an account that is locked out.
segment.target: Audit Account Lockout enables you to audit security events that are generated by a failed attempt to log on to an account that is locked out.

segment.source: If you configure this policy setting, an audit event is generated when an account cannot log on to a computer because the account is locked out.
segment.target: If you configure this policy setting, an audit event is generated when an account cannot log on to a computer because the account is locked out.

segment.source: Success audits record successful attempts and failure audits record unsuccessful attempts.
segment.target: Success audits record successful attempts and failure audits record unsuccessful attempts.

segment.source: Account lockout events are essential for understanding user activity and detecting potential attacks.
segment.target: Account lockout events are essential for understanding user activity and detecting potential attacks.

segment.source: This subcategory failure logon attempts, when account was already locked out.
segment.target: This subcategory failure logon attempts, when account was already locked out.

segment.source: We recommend tracking account lockouts, especially for high value domain or local accounts (database administrators, built-in local administrator account, domain administrators, service accounts, domain controller accounts, and so on).
segment.target: We recommend tracking account lockouts, especially for high value domain or local accounts (database administrators, built-in local administrator account, domain administrators, service accounts, domain controller accounts, and so on).

segment.source: This subcategory doesn’t have Success events, so there is no recommendation to enable Success auditing for this subcategory.
segment.target: This subcategory doesn’t have Success events, so there is no recommendation to enable Success auditing for this subcategory.

segment.source: We recommend tracking account lockouts, especially for high value domain or local accounts (database administrators, built-in local administrator account, domain administrators, service accounts, domain controller accounts, and so on).
segment.target: We recommend tracking account lockouts, especially for high value domain or local accounts (database administrators, built-in local administrator account, domain administrators, service accounts, domain controller accounts, and so on).

segment.source: This subcategory doesn’t have Success events, so there is no recommendation to enable Success auditing for this subcategory.
segment.target: This subcategory doesn’t have Success events, so there is no recommendation to enable Success auditing for this subcategory.

segment.source: We recommend tracking account lockouts, especially for high value domain or local accounts (database administrators, built-in local administrator account, domain administrators, service accounts, domain controller accounts, and so on).
segment.target: We recommend tracking account lockouts, especially for high value domain or local accounts (database administrators, built-in local administrator account, domain administrators, service accounts, domain controller accounts, and so on).

segment.source: This subcategory doesn’t have Success events, so there is no recommendation to enable Success auditing for this subcategory.
segment.target: This subcategory doesn’t have Success events, so there is no recommendation to enable Success auditing for this subcategory.

segment.source: 4625(F): An account failed to log on.
segment.target: 4625(F): An account failed to log on.
